title: Academic integrity
description: This interactive guide will develop your understanding of academic integrity and its role in your studies. We will examine how to avoid key forms of academic malpractice, exploring tools and strategies (including those involving generative artificial intelligence) that can support you.

title: Adding page numbers in Microsoft Word [video]
description: How to add page numbers in Word.

title: All formats guide
description: This page lists all our online guides with links to both the online interactive version and a downloadable text-only version, which is ideal for printing or for those needing a more accessible version to use with screen readers.

title: Avoiding plagiarism through good academic practice
description: This guide explores some of the issues surrounding academic integrity, providing you with techniques to help you to avoid plagiarism when referring the work of others and to add your own voice into your work.

title: Choosing your dissertation topic
description: Getting started with your dissertation can be a challenge. To help and support you, this guide takes you through the early steps of identifying your research question and objectives.

title: Delivering your presentation
description: Learn how to improve your presentation skills as well as tips for presenting confidently through this interactive guide.

title: Designing your presentation
description: When presenting, you'll need to consider what to display visually to keep your audience engaged. In this guide, we offer design tips for your presentation and investigate different tools to create visual aids.

title: Develop your digital capabilities
description: This Library support guide is designed to help you assess your current skills and provide the right resources to support your growth. Whether you are looking to enhance your knowledge, develop new competencies, or stay ahead in the digital landscape, here you will find comprehensive tools, guides, and learning materials to assist you in achieving your goals.

title: Digital skills certifications
description: The University of Manchester provides students with the opportunity to receive a range of professional Certifications including Microsoft Fundamentals, Office and AI free-of-charge. This page contains all of the information you will need to prepare for and take a certification assessment.

title: Developing and communicating your argument
description: Through a five-step technique, this guide takes you through the process of identifying your overall argument and organising your ideas into a coherent structure.

title: Evaluating sources of information
description: Learn the skills you need to identify high-quality information to use in your work through this guide. We explore the process of evaluating the sources you find through your searches, so that you can ensure they're relevant, reliable and intellectually rigorous.

title: Evaluating sources of information [podcast]
description: In this podcast and activity, you will learn how to question your sources. Evaluating your sources is all about asking questions.

title: What is feedback? [video]
description: A video from the guide to Making the most of academic feedback

title: Why is feedback useful? [video]
description: A video from the guide to Making the most of academic feedback

title: How has feedback changed your approach to work? [video]
description: A video from the guide to Making the most of academic feedback

title: Define the process of feedback for the development of skills [video]
description: A video from the guide to Making the most of academic feedback

title: How do you provide feedback to individuals? [video]
description: A video from the guide to Making the most of academic feedback

title: What methods do you use to track progress? [video]
description: A video from the guide to Making the most of academic feedback

title: How do you analyse performance?
description: A video from the guide to Making the most of academic feedback

title: How do you prioritise the feedback you receive? [video]
description: A video from the guide to Making the most of academic feedback

title: Feeling nervous about your upcoming viva? [podcast]
description: Feeling nervous about your upcoming viva? This episode breaks down practical strategies to help you prepare with confidence. Discover how to review your work effectively, practise with peers or supervisors, and manage nerves during the conversation.

title: Getting started with report writing
description: Explore key elements of producing a written report through this interactive guide. Covering structure, purpose, language and referencing, it highlights important considerations to help you write clear and concise reports.

title: Getting started with subject databases
description: Discover what you can find in your subject databases through this interactive guide. We explore why databases are an important research tool and how to select the right databases for your research area.

title: Getting the most from your reading
description: To improve your approach to academic reading, try the practical strategies covered in this interactive guide. We explore how to locate the most appropriate material for your needs and how to approach your reading systematically.

title: Group work
description: Learn tools and techniques to get your group working collaboratively through this interactive guide. We show how to get started with group projects and ways to stay on task until completion.

title: The Know, Want to Know, Learn (KWL) method [video]
description: How to use the Know, Want to Know, Learn method in your studies.

title: How to write a good literature review [video]
description: How to write a good literature review

title: Essay writing [podcast]
description: In this podcast we will introduce you to essay writing and its most common elements.

title: Introduction to referencing [podcast]
description: Referencing is a way of acknowledging the sources you have referred to in your work. Listen to this podcast to learn more.

title: Library support for assessment
description: Here you can find all the Library resources and support for revision and assessment, including skills-practice activities, interactive guides, podcasts, and workshops.

title: Library support for digital skills
description: Identify areas to further develop your digital capabilities through this interactive guide. We cover the digital capabilities framework and how to get started with LinkedIn Learning's suite of expert-led online courses.

title: Library support for dissertations
description: Find all the Library resources and support for planning and writing your dissertation here in one place. This guide covers guidance on choosing your topic, carrying out a literature review and referring to other people's ideas in your work.

title: Library support for group work
description: For all your group work needs, the Library has put together a guide featuring all our resources, including support on getting organised, staying on track, and getting the most out of working with others.

title: Library support for presentations
description: Explore all the Library's resources on presentations, gathered in one place in this guide. Here you can find support on how to plan, design, and deliver presentations with confidence.

title: Library support for referencing
description: Discover all the resources and support on referencing available to you from the Library through this guide. You can find guidance on how to reference different types of sources, different referencing styles, and using referencing software.

title: Library support for searching
description: This guide gathers together all the Library's resources and support on searching. This includes guides to help you find high-quality, relevant sources and making the most of advanced searching techniques.

title: Library support for writing
description: Discover all the Library resources and support for writing gathered together in this guide. Here you can find workshops, interactive guides, and strategies to help you overcome challenges with writing such as getting started and writer's block.

title: LinkedIn Learning
description: This library guide is designed to support your access to LinkedIn Learning, an extensive library of expert-led, on-line courses that can help you enhance your skills.

title: Making the most of academic feedback
description: Throughout your academic career you will receive a considerable amount of feedback from your tutors and markers. The feedback you receive is one of the most important interactions you will have not only with your tutor, but also with your learning. We have put together this series of guides to help you understand, analyse and act on the feedback you receive.

title: Modes and methods of feedback [video]
description: Modes and methods of feedback may be slightly different depending on the context, however the aims of feedback remain largely the same. Watch the video to find out what feedback can look like in a different environments.

title: New Assessment Types [podcast]
description: Providing evidence through clear referencing also demonstrates the breadth and depth of your reading around your topic.

title: Paraphrasing and summarising [video]
description: The importance of paraphrasing and summarising

title: Planning and reviewing your search
description: Identify the key concepts and terms you need for your search through this guide. We explore how to locate and search relevant databases for your topic so you can find the information you need.

title: Planning your dissertation
description: Supporting you along the key stages in planning to write your dissertation, this guide highlights some useful tools to help you along the way.

title: Planning your presentation
description: Get to grips with the process of planning your presentation through this interactive guide. We provide useful techniques to ensure your presentation stays focussed and meets the requirements of your task, directly addressing the topic at hand.

title: Providing evidence through clear referencing [podcast]
description: Providing evidence through clear referencing also demonstrates the breadth and depth of your reading around your topic.
link: Learn what defines a strong literature review and how to synthesize research, identify gaps, and set the context for your own study. Perfect for students preparing dissertations or research projects.

title: Proofreading your writing
description: Examining editing and proofreading as different stages of developing your work, this guide takes you through a range of strategies to help you make your work the best it can be.

title: Referring to other people's ideas in your work
description: Understand the principles behind referencing and why it's critical to good academic practice through this interactive guide. We'll also explore how you can use references as evidence for your argument and how to differentiate the ideas of others from your own voice.

title: Revision strategies
description: Learn strategies you can use to manage your revision effectively at each stage.

title: Searching effectively
description: Introducing key strategies for refining search results, this guide shows you how to make the most of keyword planning, Boolean operators, and advanced techniques for web and database searches. It also highlights how to evaluate sources for reliability and relevance, helping you to find trustworthy, high-quality information efficiently.

title: Specialist Library Support
description: Looking for guidance on referencing software, systematic review, business data and statistics? These resources are now available via our new Specialist Library Support pages.

title: Strategies for dealing with procrastination
description: Mindfulness can have a positive impact on your wellbeing. It can help you face the challenges you'll encounter as a researcher by improving concentration and grounding you in the here and now. This resource will give you an introduction to mindfulness and guide you through various mindfulness practices.

title: Strategies for effective learning
description: Through tips and techniques, this guide supports you in forming a strategic approach to study. By evaluating and growing your understanding of the learning materials you encounter in your studies, you can track and continually improve your learning development.

title: Strategies for effective note making
description: Examining note making for different contexts, this guide considers the importance of making notes and organising them for continued use in your learning. We introduce different note making strategies and ways to ensure your notes effectively support your studies.

title: Paraphrasing and summarising [video]
description: The importance of paraphrasing and summarizing

title: Thinking, reading, and writing critically
description: Interrogate what it means to be critical through this interactive guide. We highlight practical strategies you can use in your academic reading and writing, through which you'll be able to demonstrate the sought-after skill of critical analysis in your assignments.

title: Writing your essay
description: Explore the purpose and process of writing an essay through this interactive guide. We demonstrate how you can ensure your ideas are coherent and logical, so that every section of your essay supports your argument.

title: Writing your literature review
description: Explore the purpose and process of writing a literature review through this interactive guide. We demonstrate how to organise your notes, thoughts and ideas in a structured way so that you can group, compare and analyse your research sources.

title: Tips for Presenting [podcast]
description: By providing accurate references for the sources you use, you can place your writing in the context of work being done on the topic and acknowledge the work done by others. This is key to ensuring others understand your work and in avoiding academic malpractice such as plagiarism.

title: Top Ten Tips: Group Work [podcast]
description: Listen to this Student Team top tips podcast to help you managing situations when you are working as part of a group.

title: Top Tips: Referencing [podcast]
description: Listen to this conversation between student team discussing referencing tips for students.

title: Understanding the procrastination cycle
description: Learn to explore your own procrastination behaviour, and recognise how it is often rooted in certain negative thoughts and emotions.

title: Using generative AI in your learning
description: This library guide explores important considerations such as academic integrity, referencing, and copyright in the context of generative AI. We do not provide instruction on how to use AI tools themselves, for that, we recommend exploring LinkedIn Learning.

title: Using Special Collections in your work
description: Introducing the University's Special Collections, this guide demonstrates their importance in research and how you can use critical analysis to get the most from them.

title: Writing an abstract
description: Learn about abstracts and how to write one using this interactive guide. We show what an abstract should contain, how it differs from other kinds of writing, and how they vary across different contexts.

title: Writing critically [podcast]
description: Writing critically is a skill that requires analysis and discussion of a topic rather than merely description. Listen to find out how to achieve this throughout your studies.

title: Writing scientific reports
description: Learn how scientific reports differ from general report writing using this interactive guide. We cover the structure, conventions, and other key elements of reports.

title: Accurate referencing [podcast]
description: You will often be marked on your ability to assess, compare, contrast, critically evaluate and analyse arguments. Accurate referencing will help to make it clear which parts of your writing are based on the work of others and which are your own analysis and evaluation.
